channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Magic Leap 2 is coming later this year, says CEO Peggy Johnson
item.description: The business-focused headset will be generally available to buy in early 2022.

item.title: Background replacement videos are coming to Google Meet
item.description: Along with other updates, you'll have more control over how you see your own feed.

item.title: 'Sonic the Hedgehog 2' is getting another spikey sidekick
item.description: A familiar sidekick is headed to the Sonic sequel.

item.title: PlayStation Plus could soon include a video service
item.description: Sony may offer movies to PlayStation Plus subscribers through a briefly hinted-at Video Pass service.

item.title: Keep your gaming laptop safe with this $32 cooling stand
item.description: Gaming laptops run hot, and the HAVIT Cooling Pad is Amazon’s choice for keeping them cool. This cooling stand uses three large, quiet fans running at up to 1,000 RPM to protect your laptop from overheating.

item.title: All about Eve: The upstart PC brand struggling to pay back jilted customers
item.description: Three years after the first Eve-branded computers went on sale, some customers still haven’t received their machines, and attempts to reclaim their money have largely gone unanswered. Now, with a bevy of new products in the works — including a follow-up to that original V PC — Eve seemingly hopes its new customers will forget how much it still owes some of its earliest backers.

item.title: Riding in the Lucid Air luxury EV
item.description: Ahead of beginning the deliveries of the Lucid Air to customers in the second half of this year, the electric vehicle startup gave us a ride in its Grand Touring release candidate vehicle.

item.title: The Tamagotchi Pix lets you take digital pet selfies
item.description: The new Tamagotchi Pix has a camera for taking photos with your pet.

item.title: Apple supplier is the latest target of a $50 million ransomware hack
item.description: Apple's key MacBook supplier, Quanta, is the target of ransomware hackers threatening to leak Mac blueprints

item.title: The latest Google mesh WiFi system is 20 percent off at Adorama
item.description: Google's mesh WiFi system is 20 percent off at Adorama, bringing it down to $160.

item.title: My Arcade's latest Micro Player is a 'Street Fighter II: Champion Edition' replica
item.description: My Arcade is releasing a Micro Player of iconic beat-em-up Street Fighter II: Champion Edition in partnership with Capcom.

item.title: Cadillac's Lyriq EV will boast 300-plus miles of range
item.description: Cadillac plans to release its all-electric Lyriq crossover SUV beginning in the first half of 2022, and which customers will be able to reserve starting this September.

item.title: 'Roku Originals' will become the new name for Quibi's catalog
item.description: Roku is getting closer to releasing that host of content it picked up from Quibi.

item.title: Data-scraping tool can link millions of Facebook profiles to email addresses
item.description: A security researcher shared a video with Vice, Ars Technica and others, showing how a tool can match email addresses to Facebook profiles in bulk — even if the users chose to keep their email details hidden from the public.

item.title: Samsung opens Galaxy Upcycling beta to turn old phones into IoT gadgets
item.description: Samsung is opening up its Galaxy Upcycling at Home beta to users in the US, UK and Korea.

item.title: The Morning After: Meet the new iMacs, iPad Pros and Apple TV 4K
item.description: Apple revealed new PCs and tablets but didn't stop there. Check out the AirTag locators and a new Apple TV with a redesigned remote.

item.title: FIA launches 'groundbreaking' electric GT category
item.description: The FIA has unveiled a new electric GT motorsports category with the aim of pushing manufacturers to develop battery, charging and other tech for high-performance road cars.

item.title: TP-Link's latest WiFi 6 mesh system starts at $280
item.description: TP-Link has unveiled the Deco X68, a tri-band WiFi-6 mesh router system with reasonable pricing and several improvements over the Deco X60 WiFi 6 model.

item.title: Google responds to last month's WebView nightmare on Android
item.description: Google is working on improvements for its WebView apps and plans to release more updates for the software and Chrome in order to avoid a repeat of last month's Android crash.

item.title: Amazon is bringing its palm-reading payment tech to Whole Foods stores
item.description: Amazon's contactless payments are making a significant expansion to Whole Foods Market stores.

item.title: Bowers & Wilkins launches PI7 and PI5 premium true wireless earphones
item.description: Bowers & Wilkins has launched the PI7 and the PI5, two new true wireless earbuds models, which it says don't compromise "sound quality for wireless convenience."

item.title: Instagram adds new anti-harassment tools to block abusive DMs
item.description: Instagram is adding new features to prevent harassment in direct messages.

item.title: Logitech launches Combo Touch keyboard cases for the new iPad Pros
item.description: Logitech has, quite predictably, released new versions of its Combo Touch keyboard case for Apple's newly announced iPad Pros.

item.title: The new Apple TV 4K arrives with HDMI 2.1, Thread wireless tech
item.description: The new Apple TV has HDMI 2.1 and a new type of mesh networking technology built-in.

item.title: TikTok uploads are broken
item.description: Many TikTok users are currently unable to post to the app due to a strange issue affecting uploads to the video app.
